I can help. Do you have access to your router? You need this in order to port forward. In addition, do you have Skype or Teamviewer?

If I have done this right you should be able to connect to my server with the IP (Note: I have dynamic IP so it might change >.>):

92.99.96.135 port 2075 (92.99.96.135:2075)

I changed the HTTP port to 8080 since (for some reason) the default port (80) gives me an error. (I don't know if this has any effect but just in case)

Edited August 24, 2014 by Potato Shadow
Some formatting for clarity

If I have done this right you should be able to connect to my server with the IP (Note: I have dynamic IP so it might change >.>):

92.99.96.135 port 2075 (92.99.96.135:2075)

I changed the HTTP port to 8080 since (for some reason) the default port (80) gives me an error. (I don't know if this has any effect but just in case)

It works! How much uptime are you expecting for it?

It works! How much uptime are you expecting for it?

As long as my laptop doesn't run out of charge while I'm sleeping or if someone from my house closes my laptop or my ISP decides it's another day to troll me it'll be up for basically 24 hours.

For whoever couldn't connect to the server, the problem was with my Ethernet cable for some reason making my access "Limited" but it wasn't with a wireless connection. So I set it so it relies on the wireless connecting instead of the Ethernet cable so that doesn't happen again.
